Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Excusable \Ex*cus"a*ble\a. [L. excusabilis: cf. F. excusable. See {Excuse}.] That may be excused, forgiven, justified, or acquitted of blame; pardonable; as, the man is excusable; an excusable action. -- {Ex*cus"a*ble*ness}, n. -- {Ex*cus"a*bly}, adv. [1913 Webster]
The excusableness of my dissatisfaction. --Boyle. [1913 Webster]
excusable adj 1: capable of being overlooked [ant: {inexcusable}] 2: easily excused or forgiven; "a venial error" [syn: {forgivable}, {venial}]
